Krauss second Union Station album Every Time You Say Goodbye was released in 1992 and she went on to win her second Grammy Award for Best Bluegrass Album of the year She then joined the Grand Ole Opry in 1993 at the age of 21ref namecmtbio  She was the youngest cast member at the time and the first bluegrass artist to join the Opry in 29 yearsrefrefrefrefrefref She also collaborated on a project with the Cox Family in 1994 a bluegrass album called I Know Who Holds Tomorrow Mandolin and guitar player Dan Tyminski replaced Tim Stafford in Union Station in 1994 Late in the year Krauss recorded with the band Shenandoah bandShenandoah on its single Somewhere in the Vicinity of the Heart which brought her to the country music Top Ten for the first time and it won the Grammy Award for Best Country Collaboration with Vocals Also in 1994 Krauss collaborated with Suzy Bogguss Kathy Mattea and Crosby Stills Nash  YoungCrosby Stills and Nash to contribute Teach Your Children to the AIDS benefit album Red Hot  Country produced by the Red Hot Organization In 1997 she recorded vocals and violin for Half a Mind on Tommy Shaws 7 Deadly Zens album

Now That Ive Found You A Collection a compilation of older releases and some covers of her favorite works by other artists was released in 1995 Some of these covers include Bad Companys Desolation Angels albumOh Atlanta the Foundations  Daniel Joseph SchaferDan Schafers Baby Now That Ive Found You which was used in the Australian hit comedy movie The Castle 1997 Australian filmThe Castle and the Beatles I Will with Tony Furtadorefhttpwwwroundercomidalbumphpcatalog_id5930 Now That Ive Found You by Sidney Cox for Rounder Records Retrieved June 12 2006ref A cover of Keith Whitleys When You Say Nothing at All reached number three on the Billboard country chartrefmagazineBillBoard
dateJune 10 1995accessdateJuly 2 2012ref the album peaked in the top fifteen on the allgenre Billboard 200Billboard 200 chart and sold two million copies to become Krauss first RIAA certificationdoubleplatinum albumref publisherBillBoard dateJune 10 1995 accessdateJuly 2 2012ref Krauss also was nominated for four Country Music Association Awards and won all of themrefref

So Long So Wrong another Union Station album was released in 1997 and won the Grammy Award for Best Bluegrass Album One critic said its sound was rather untraditional and likely to change quite a few  minds about bluegrassrefhttpgeorgegrahamcomkrausshtml So Long So Wrong review by George Graham The Graham Weekly Album Review Nonbsp1065 as broadcast on WVIAFM April 16 1997 Retrieved June 12 2006ref Included on the album is the track It Doesnt Matter which was featured in the secondseason premiere episode of Buffy the Vampire SlayerrefWhen She Was Bad Buffy episodeWhen She Was Bad originally released September 15 1997 Twentieth Century Fox and Joss Whedonref and was included on the Buffy soundtrack in 1999

Her next solo release in 1999 Forget About It included one of her two tracks to appear on the Billboard Adult Contemporary chartadult contemporary chart Stay The album was certified gold and charted within the top seventyfive of the Billboard 200 and in the top five of the country chart In addition the track That Kind of Love was included in another episode of Buffy the Vampire SlayerrefEntropy Buffy episodeEntropy originally released April 30 2002 Twentieth Century Fox and Joss Whedonref

2000present Current career
Adam Steffey left Union Station in 1998 and was replaced by renowned dobro player Jerry Douglasrefhttpwwwcandaceashercompresshtml September 2001 Review in Your Gazette Melbourne Australia by George Peden These Ladies Are New Favourites  by Candace Asher on CandaceAshercom September 2001 Retrieved June 6 2006ref Douglas had provided studio backup to Krauss records since 1987s Too Late to Cry Their next album New Favorite was released on August 14 2001 The album went on to win the Grammy for Best Bluegrass Album with the single The Lucky One Alison Krauss songThe Lucky One winning a Grammy as well New Favorite was followed up by the double platinum double album Live Alison Krauss albumLive in 2002 and a release of a DVD of the same live performance in 2003 Both the album and the DVD were recorded during a performance at The Louisville Palace and both the album and DVD have been certified double Platinum Also in 2002 she played a singing voice for one of the characters in the animated comedy film Eight Crazy Nights

Lonely Runs Both Ways was released in 2004 and eventually became another Alison Krauss  Union Station gold certified album Ron Block described Lonely Runs Both Ways as pretty much what weve always done in terms of song selection and the style in which those songs were recordedrefref Krauss believes the group was probably the most unprepared weve ever been for the album and that songs were chosen as needed rather than planned beforehandref namegac1  She also performed a duet with Brad Paisley on his album Mud on the Tires in the single Whiskey Lullaby The single was quickly ranked in the top fifty of the Billboard Hot 100Billboard Hot 100 and the top five of the Hot Country Songs and won the Country Music Association Awards for Best Musical Event and Best Music Video of the year


In 2007 Krauss and Robert Plant released the collaborative album titled Raising Sand RIAAcertified platinum the album was nominated for and won five Grammy Awardsrefrefrefref at the 51st Annual Grammy Awards including Album of the Year Best Contemporary FolkAmericana Album and Record of the Year Please Read the Letter Krauss and Plant recorded a Crossroads special in October 2007 for the CMT US TV channelCountry Music Television network which first aired on February 12 2008

Returning with Union Station Krauss released an album called Paper Airplane albumPaper Airplane on April 12 2011refref the followup album to Lonely Runs Both Ways 2004 Mike Shipley the recording and mixing engineer for the album said that the album had a lengthy production time because of Krauss nonstop migrainesrefrefrefref Nevertheless Paper Airplane became Krausss highestcharting album in the US reaching number three on the Billboard 200 on topping both the country and bluegrass album charts

In 2014 Krauss and her band Union Station toured with Willie Nelson and Family with special guests Kacey Musgraves and The Devil Makes Three bandthe Devil Makes Threerefrefrefref

Capitol Records released Windy City Alison Krauss albumWindy City an album of country and bluegrass classics produced by Buddy Cannon and her first solo release in 17 years on February 17 2017refref Krauss received two nominations at the 60th Annual Grammy Awards for Best Country Solo Performance and Best American Roots Performance

In August 2021 Krauss announced she was releasing a sequel album to Raising Sand with Robert Plant called Raise the Roof albumRaise the Roofrefref The album was released in November that year and Krauss and Plant went on tour as a duo in 2022refrefrefref

Other work
 on May 5 2008
Krauss has made guest appearances on other records on lead vocals Vocal harmonyharmony vocals and fiddle In 1987 at the age of 15 she played fiddle on the album The Western Illinois Rag by Americana musician Chris Vallillo In 1993 she recorded vocals for the Phish song If I Could in Los Angelesrefhttpwwwphishcombandhistoryindexphpyear1993 Phishnbsp Band History  Retrieved December 10 2009ref In 1997 she sang harmony vocals in both English and Irish on the album Runaway Sunday by Folk music of IrelandIrish traditional band Altan bandAltan In 1998 she played and sang on the title track of Hawaiian slackkey artist Ledward Kaapanas album Waltz of the Windrefref

Krauss had her only number one hit in 2000 receiving vocal credit for Buy Me a Rose She has contributed to numerous motion picture soundtracks most notably O Brother Where Art Thou soundtrackO Brother Where Art Thou 2000 She and Dan Tyminski contributed multiple tracks including Ill Fly AwayAlison Krauss and Gillian WelchIll Fly Away with Gillian Welch Down to the River to Pray and I Am a Man of Constant Sorrow In the film Tyminskis vocals on I Am a Man of Constant Sorrow were used for George Clooneys characterrefhttpnewsbbccouk1hientertainmentmusic1845962stm O Brother Why Art Thou So Popular BBC News February 28 2002 Retrieved June 25 2006ref The soundtrack sold over seven million copies and won the Grammy for Album of the Year in 2002refref Both Krauss and the surprisingly popular album were creditedref namenprhttpswwwnprorgtemplatesstorystoryphpstoryId1138127 Interview on NPR Morning Edition Bob Edwards NPR February 15 2002 Retrieved July 10 2006ref with reviving interest in bluegrass She has said however that she believes Americans already liked bluegrass and other lessheard musical genres and that the film merely provided easy exposure to the musicref namepbsinterviewhttpswebarchiveorgweb20021022111958httpwwwpbsorgklruaustininterviewsakrauss_interviewhtml Jerry Douglas and Ron Block of Union Station discuss their role in bluegrass music PBSorg May 3 2002 via the Wayback Machine Retrieved July 28 2009ref She did not appear in the movie at her own request because she was pregnant during its filmingref namebnref

In 2007 Krauss released A Hundred Miles or More A Collection an album of new songs soundtrack tunes and duets with artists such as John Waite James Taylor Brad Paisley and Natalie MacMasterrefref The album was  successful commercially but given a lukewarm reception by criticsrefref One of the tracks Missing You John Waite songMissing You a duet with Waite and a cover of his hit single from 1984 was similarly received as a single On August 11 television network Great American Country aired a onehour special Alison Krauss A Hundred Miles or More based on the albumrefref

Krauss appeared on Heart bandHearts March 2010 concert DVD Night at Sky Church providing the lead vocals for the song These DreamsrefhttpwwwseattlepicomaemusicarticleMusicDVDReviewHeartNightatSkyChurch1079088php Music Review  Night At Sky Church Jack Goodstein April 26 2011 SeattlePIcomref

Other soundtracks for which Krauss has performed include Twister 1996 filmSoundtracksTwister The Prince of Egypt soundtrackThe Prince of Egypt Eight Crazy NightsSoundtrackEight Crazy Nights Mona Lisa SmileSoundtrackMona Lisa Smile Divine Secrets of the YaYa Sisterhood filmDivine Secrets of the YaYa Sisterhood Alias TV seriesAlias Bambi IISoundtrackBambi II and Cold Mountain soundtrackCold Mountain She contributed Jubilee to the 2004 documentary Paper Clips filmPaper Clips The Cold Mountain songs she sang The Scarlet Tide with T Bone Burnett and Elvis Costello and You Will Be My Ain True Love with Sting musicianSting were each nominated for an Academy AwardsAcademy Award She performed both songs at the 76th Academy Awards the first with Costello and Burnett and the other with Stingref nameoscarshttpswebarchiveorgweb20040215024955httpwwwoscarsorgpresspressreleases2004040213bhtml Sting Alison Krauss Elvis Costello and T Bone Burnett to Perform at The 76th Academy Awards Press release by Toni Thompson for the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences via the Wayback Machine on February 14 2004 Retrieved July 28 2009ref She produced Nickel Creeks Nickel Creek albumdebut album 2000 and the followup This Side 2002 which won Krauss her first Grammy award as a producer

Krauss performed on Moody Bluegrass musical projectMoody Bluegrass A Nashville Tribute to the Moody Bluesrefref

She participated in William Edward ChildsBilly Childs 2014 tribute album to Laura Nyro Map to the Treasure Reimagining Laura Nyro performing on the track And When I Dierefrefrefref

Krauss also appears on Def Leppards twelfth studio album Diamond Star Halos released March 2022 as a featured vocalist on the songs This Guitar and Lifelessref nameErlewineref Krauss duetted with High Valley on the groups 2023 single Do This Liferefref

Reception and influences

Krauss earliest musical experience was as an instrumentalist though her style has grown to focus more on her vocalsref namecmtbio  with a band providing most of the instrumentation Musicians she enjoys include vocalists Lou Gramm of Foreigner bandForeigner and Paul Rodgers of Bad CompanyrefhttpcgicnncomSHOWBIZMusic991116wbkraussindexhtml Krauss cultivates bluegrass into crossover success  by Neil Curry for CNN on November 16 1999 Retrieved June 29 2006refref for JAM Music by Jane Stevenson Retrieved June 27 2006refrefhttplubbockonlinecomnews101497UX0381htm Krauss still hanging on to eclectic style for the Los Angeles TimesThe Washington Post on October 13 1997 Retrieved June 29 2006ref Krauss family listened to folk records while she was growing up but she had friends who exposed her to such acts as ACDC Carly Simon the Rolling Stones Lynyrd Skynyrd and Electric Light OrchestraELOrefref She cites Dolly Parton with whom she has since collaborated a number of times as a major influence Some credit Krauss and Union Station at least partially with a recent revival of interest in bluegrass music in the United Statesref namenpr  Despite being together for nearly two decades and winning numerous awards she said the group was just beginning right now in 2002 because in spite of all the great things that have happened for the band she feels musically its just really beginningref namepbsinterview  Although she alternates between solo releases and works with the band she has said there is no difference in her involvement between the tworef namebn 

As a group AKUS have been called American favourites worldbeatersrefhttpswwwbbccoukmusicreviewshpqv Alison Krauss  Union Station Live Review by Chris Jones for BBC Retrieved June 15 2006ref and the tightest band aroundref namebbclonelyhttpswwwbbccoukmusicfolkcountryreviewsalisonkrauss_lonelyshtml Alison Krauss  Union Station Lonely Runs Both Ways Review by Sue Keogh for BBC Retrieved June 15 2006ref While they have been successful as a group many reviews note Krauss still remains the undisputed star and rocksolid foundation and have described her as the bands focusref namebgwlonelyhttpwwwbluegrassworkscomreviewphpreviewID112 Alison Krauss  Union Station  Lonely Runs Both Ways CD 2004  by Ben Fitzgerald Bluegrass Works December 13 2006 Retrieved June 15 2006ref with an angelicref namebbclonely  voice that flows like honeyref namebgwlonely  Her work has been compared to that of the Cox Family Bill Monroe and Del McCoury and has in turn been credited with influencing various progressive bluegrassNewgrass artists including Nickel Creek for which she acted as record producer on two of their albumsref namekraussabouthttpfolkmusicaboutcomodartistsazpAlisonKrausshtm Alison Krauss and Union Station  by Kim Ruehl on FolkMusicAboutcom Retrieved June 24 2006ref In addition to her work with Nickel Creek she has acted as producer to the Cox Family Reba McEntire and Alan Jacksonrefhttpsarchivetoday20120904200845httpwwwgactvcomgacnw_headlinesarticle0GAC_26063_472411700html Alison Krauss Produces Alan Jackson from Great American Country on May 10 2006 citing The Tennessean Retrieved June 26 2006ref Adam Sweeting of The Guardian has said Krauss and Union Station are superb when they stick to hoedowns and oldtime musichillbilly music but much less convincing when they lurch towards the middle of the roadrefhttpartsguardiancoukreviewsstory011712135423000html Alison Krauss and Union Station Lonely Runs Both Ways Rounder Records by Adam Sweeting for The Guardian UK November 19 2004 Retrieved June 15 2006ref Blender magazineBlender magazine has said the flavorless repertoire Krauss sings steers her toward Lite FMrefhttpwwwmetacriticcommusicartistskraussalisonlonelyrunsbothways Lonely Runs Both Ways on Metacritic originally from Blender magazine JanFeb 2005 Retrieved June 15 2006ref In addition Q magazineQ magazine and The OnionThe Onion AV Club have said their newer releases are pretty much the usual and that although Krauss is generally adventurous these recent releases contain nothing to alienate the massesrefhttpwwwmetacriticcommusicartistskraussalisonnewfavorite New Favorite on Metacritic originally from Q Magazine September 2001 and The Onion AV Club Retrieved June 15 2006ref

Voice themes and musical style
Krauss possesses a soprano voice which has been described as angelicref namebbclonely refref 

She has said her musical influences include J D Crowe Ricky Skaggs and Tony Ricerefhttpwwwdirtynelsoncomlinen102krausshtml New Favorite  by Kerry Dexter from Dirty Linen Nonbsp102 OctNov 2 Retrieved June 29 2006ref Many of her songs are described as sadref by David Veitch for JAM Music Retrieved June 27 2006ref and are often about romantic lovelove especially lost love Though Krauss has a close involvement with her group and a long career in music she rarely performs music she has written herself She has also described her general approach to constructing an album as starting with a single song and selecting other tracks based on the first to give the final album a somewhat consistent theme and moodref namebn ref namereviveref She most commonly performs in the bluegrass and country genres though she has had two songs on the adult contemporary musicadult contemporary charts has worked with rock artists such as Phishref namecmtbio  and Sting musicianStingref nameoscars  and is sometimes said to stray into pop musicref namenytimes refhttpgeorgegrahamcomreviewsakus4html Alison Krauss  Union Station New Favorite by George Graham The Graham Weekly Album Review Nonbsp1250 broadcast on WVIAFM August 18 2001 Retrieved July 8 2006ref

Music videos
Krauss did not think she would make music videos at the beginning of her career After recording her first she was convinced it was so bad that she would never do another Nonetheless she has continued to make further videos Many of the first videos she saw were by bluegrass artists Dan Tyminski has noted that the Michael Jacksons Thriller music videovideo for Thriller was very popular at the time she was first exposed to music videos She has made suggestions on the style or theme to some videos though she tends to leave such decisions to the music video directordirector of the particular video The group chooses directors by seeking out people who have previously directed videos that band members have enjoyed The director for a video to If I Didnt Know Any Better from Lonely Runs Both Ways for example was selected because Krauss enjoyed work he had done with Def Leppard and she wondered what he could do with their music While style decisions are generally left to the various directors of the videos manynbsp including for The Lucky One Alison Krauss songThe Lucky One Restless Goodbye is All We Have New Favorite and If I Didnt Know Any Better  follow a pattern In all of these videos Krauss walks sometimes interacting with other people while the rest of the band follows herref namegacvideo ref namegacinterviewhttpwwwgactvcomgacshows_ngtepisode0GAC_26155_4402000html Interview with Alison Krauss and Dan Tyminski on GAC Nights Great American Country originally broadcast June 27 2006 retrieved June 28 2006ref

Performances
Krauss has said she used to dislike working in the studio where she had to perform the same song repeatedly but has come to like studio work roughly the same as concertlive stage performances Her own favorite concert experiences include watching three Foreigner bandForeigner concerts during a single tour a Dolly Parton concert and a Larry Sparks concertrefInterview with Krauss from the Alison Krauss  Union Station Live DVD by Rounder Records released in 2003ref

She appeared on Austin City Limits in 1992 and opened the show in 1995 with Union Stationrefhttpswebarchiveorgweb20011111154844httpwwwpbsorgklruaustinartistsprogram85html Alison Krauss on Austin City Limits from PBS from 1996 via the Wayback Machine retrieved July 28 2009ref The New Favorite tour after AKUS album of the same name was planned to start September 12 2001 in Cincinnati Ohio but was delayed until September 28 in Savannah Georgia following the September 11 2001 attacksSeptember 11 terrorist attacksrefhttpswebarchiveorgweb20021017222631httpwwwmtvcomnewsarticles144889909172001krauss_alisonjhtml COUNTRY BEAT Alison Krauss Wynonna Judd Dolly Parton  for MTVcom on September 17 2001 retrieved June 25 2006ref Krauss took part in the Down from the Mountain tour in 2002 which featured many artists from the O Brother Where Art Thou soundtrackO Brother Where Art Thou soundtrackrefhttpswebarchiveorgweb20030223071632httpwwwmtvcomnewsarticles145011510172001krauss_alisonjhtml Krauss Loveless Among Down From The Mountain Headliners for MTVcom on October 17 2001 retrieved June 25 2006refrefhttpwwwjimdirdencomconcert_reviewsdftmhtm Down from the Mountain tour by Jim Durden for Tomlin Communications on July 20 2002 retrieved June 25 2006ref Down from the Mountain was followed by the Great High Mountain Tour which was composed of musicians from both O Brother and Cold Mountain including Kraussref namegacinterview  She has also given several notable smaller performances including at Carnegie Hall with the Grand Ole Opryrefhttpsarchivetoday20130123142622httpwwwgactvcomgacnw_headlinesarticle0GAC_26063_472929400html Carnegie Hall performance at Great American Country March 1 2006 retrieved June 26 2006ref on Lifetime Television in a concert of female performers on the radio show A Prairie Home Companionrefhttpprairiehomepublicradioorgprograms20040501indexshtml Program details from Prairie Home Companion on May 1 2006 retrieved June 26 2006ref where she sang two songs not previously recorded on any of her albums and a performance at the White House attended by thenPresident Bill Clinton and thenVice President Al GorerefhttpwwwcybergrasscomArticlesakwhitehtml Alison Krauss at the White House  by Marian Leighton Levy at Rounder Records May 18 1995 retrieved June 29 2006ref She has also been in the White House again performing the song When You Say Nothing at Allrefref at country music performances She also performed a tribute to the Everly Brothers at which she sang All I Have to Do is Dream with Emmylou Harris and When Will I Be Loved songWhen Will I Be Loved with Vince Gillrefrefrefref She was also invited by Taylor Swift to perform with her at the 2013 CMAs and by Joshua Bell to perform with him on a Christmas album Bell said that she Krauss is someone Ive adored for so many years nowrefref She performed at DAR Constitution Hall in Washington DC on January 10 2015 as a part of The Life and Songs of Emmylou Harris An All Star Concert Celebration which is a tribute to Emmylou Harrisrefrefrefref

Awards and honors


Krauss has won twentyseven Grammy AwardsrefList of awards and nominations received by Alison Krauss List of Alison Krauss awards Retrieved February 13 2012ref over the course of her career as a solo artist as a group with Union Station as a duet with Robert Plant and as a record producer As of 2021 she ranks fourth on the list of winners of the Grammy Award recordsmost Grammy Awardsrefhttpwwwproperdistributioncomnewsfullstoryphppg6id45 Alison Krauss  Union Station Win Three Trophies at Grammys  for Proper Music Distribution on February 20 2006 retrieved June 5 2006ref She overtook Aretha Franklin for the most female wins at the Grammy Awards of 200446th Grammy Awards where Krauss won three bringing her total at the time to seventeen Franklin won her sixteenth that nightrefhttpswebarchiveorgweb20040227214603httpwwwshorefirecomartistsakrausspr_akrauss_02_09_04html Rounder recording artist becomes Grammys mosthonored female musician Press release on Shorefire and the Los Angeles Times by Jen Chapin and Robert Hilburn on February 9 2004 via the Wayback Machine Last accessed July 28 2009ref The National Academy of Recording Arts and SciencesRecording Academy which presents the Grammy Awards presented her with a special musical achievement honor in 2005refhttpswebarchiveorgweb20060901053608httpwwwcmtcomartistsnews151329311082005krauss_alisonjhtml Recording Academy Honors Krauss Scruggs McGraw and the Winans by Edward Morris for CMTcom on November 8 2005 retrieved June 7 2006ref She has also won 14 International Bluegrass Music AssociationInternational Association Awards 2 CMT Music Awardsref nameCMTA05httpswebarchiveorgweb20090602204653httpwwwcmtcommicrositescmtmusicawardsarchives2005jhtml 2005 Awards archive from CMTcom retrieved July 28 of Country Music on CMTcom retrieved July 27 2009ref

At the 76th Academy Awards in February 2004 where she performed two nominated songs from the Cold Mountain filmCold Mountain soundtrack Krauss was chosen by Hollywood shoe designer Stuart Weitzman to wear a pair of 2 million Cinderella sandals with 4 inch clear glass stiletto heels and two straps adorned with 565 Kwiat diamonds set in platinum Feeling like a rather unglamorous choice Krauss said When I first heard I was like What were they thinking I have the worst feet of anybody who will be there that night In addition to the fairytaleinspired shoes Weitzman outfitted Krauss with a Palm Tro 600 smartphone bejeweled with 3000 clearandtopazcolored Swarovski crystals The shoes were returned but Krauss kept the crystalcovered phone Weitzman chose Krauss to show off his fashions at the urging of his daughters who are fans of Krauss musicrefLee Lisa httpswebarchiveorgweb20070706191937httpwwwcmtcomartistsnews148540420040227krauss_alisonjhtml Cinderella Krauss Tries On Her Slippers Country Music TelevisionCMTcom February 27 2004 retrieved October 31 2007refrefhttpwwwgeekzoneconzcontentaspContentId2381 Grammy Awardwinner Alison Krauss to carry Swarovski crystalclad Treo 600 smartphone by Geekzoneconz retrieved November 1 2007ref


In May 2012 Alison Krauss was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Music from Berklee College of Musicrefref

In March 2015 her hometown of Champaign Illinois designated the 400 block of West Hill Street as Honorary Alison Krauss Wayref namePresseyrefrefref

On April 13 2024 Krauss became a recipient of the The Lincoln Academy of IllinoisOrder of Lincoln AwardOrder of Lincoln which is Illinois highest civilian honorrefref

Personal life
Krauss was married to musician Pat Bergeson from 1997 to 2001refrefrefref They have one child born in 1999refref

Gary Tyrone England born December 5 1963ref nameallmusic titleTy England biography accessdateJuly 8 2008 lastErlewine firstStephen Thomas authorlinkStephen Thomas Erlewine publisherAllMusicref is an American country music singer and guitarist Initially a member of Garth Brooks band England began his solo career in 1995 recording a selftitled debut album on RCA Records NashvilleRCA Nashville A second album Two Ways to Fall followed in 1996 Three years later he recorded Highways  Dance Halls under the name Tyler England on Capitol Records NashvilleCapitol Nashville and Alive and Well and Livin the Dream came in 2007 on the independent Triple T label England has charted six singles on the country chart His highestcharting single was his debut Shouldve Asked Her Faster a Nonbsp3 hit in late 1995

Biography
England began playing guitar during his youth He sang with various bands in high school and performed in his school chorus While working at a coffee shop during his time as a student at Oklahoma State University fellow student Garth Brooks met him and soon the two were roommates They performed together until failing grades forced England to move back home He did eventually get a degree in marketing but he worked at an automotive paint store

By 1988 Garth had moved to Nashville TennesseeNashville and after landing a recording contract called England to come be his guitarist and backup vocalist
In 1995 England left Brooks road band and signed to RCA Records Nashville His selftitled Ty England albumdebut album released in late 1995 produced his first chart single in the Nonbsp3 Shouldve Asked Her Fasterref nameallmusic although the albums other two singles Smoke in Her Eyes and Redneck Son fell short of Top 40 A second album Two Ways to Fall followed in 1996ref nameallmusic It produced his only other Top 40 country hit in the Nonbsp22 Irresistible You followed by All of the Above at Nonbsp46 After the latter England exited RCAs roster

In 1999 England signed to Capitol Records NashvilleCapitol Nashville the same label to which Brooks was signed at the time His third album Highways  Dance Halls was issued under the name Tyler England It produced three singles in Too Many Highways I Drove Her to Dallas which peaked at Nonbsp53 and Id Rather Have Nothing Also included on this album was a rerecording of Shouldve Asked Her Faster as well as the Bruce Robison song Travelin Soldier which would later become a Number One hit in 2003 for the Dixie Chicks He did not release another album until 2007s Alive and Well and Livin the Dreamref nameallmusic which included the noncharting singles Redneck Anthem and The Perfect Girl
